intro: Memecylon acutifolium, commonly known as the sharp-leaved memecylon, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It features lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy on the upper surface. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Memecylon acutifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
